fields.description:
If you have multiple branches open, and have to switch between them, it is often nice to leave your branches fully extended so that you can access all branches without navigating in or out through the drill downs... This feature is not consistent. 

 

I regularly navigate to any other program, only to come back to SourceTree within the hour and have all of my drill downs closed.  This does not cause a loss of work, or does not damage anything, but is a nuisance. 

 

Correction: The amount of time it took to write up this JIRA item was enough time for SourceTree to _*decide*_ to do things on it's own, didn't even have to close the application.  The application should not do anything without the user expressly telling it to do so.
fields.summary: Branch Explorer - Clears selections / drop downs

fields.description:
Buttons bar to minimize / maximise / close sometimes appear weird

Seems to appear when trying to click close button on the very top right corner.

!STButtons.png!
fields.summary: Button bar (minimize, maximize, close) appear weard
can't use ssh-agent failed with code -1

fields.description:
When using the Windows Credential Manager for Authentication to a vanilla Git server in the office, sometimes SourceTree will forget to use those credentials.


We get the error attached when trying to push and pull from repositories.


Typing in "_git config --get --global credential.helper_" to the terminal (built into ST) gives us nothing.

We then have to re-set the credential helper using "git config --global credential.helper wincred".

Typing in "git config --get --global credential.helper" then gives us "wincred" as the correct response.

At this point we can successfully Push/Pull/Fetch from repositories.
fields.summary: Windows Credential Manager gets forgotten

fields.description:
On my german Windows10, I want to use SourceTree in english language. Reason for that is, that I don't want to use translated git commands in the menu like "Zweige" for "Branches".

Anyway, it's possible to change the language from "Auto" to "Englisch" which is fine for me.

However, after each version update of SourceTree, the app is started in german language again. Funnily, the language dropdown in settings still shows english. So I don't change anything, just click OK, restart SourceTree and it's english again.

I would rather prefer not to do that after every update.
fields.summary: Language setting is reset after updates

fields.description:
The SourceTree version is 2.1.11.0, but that version can not be selected.

I have installed git-for-windows in MSYS2 using pacman (install path is c:\dev\msys64)

I've added c:\dev\msys64\cmd to the PATH, so SourceTree finds the git.exe installed by git-for-windows and it even prints the correct git-version (2.14.1) and everything works.
 If i look in the user.config file I see that the GitSystemPath is correct:
{code:java}
<setting name="GitSystemPath" serializeAs="String">
  <value>C:\dev\msys64</value>
</setting>{code}
But if I close and restart SourceTree then git is not found anymore, and if checking the GitSystemPath then it is empty.

But if I close and restart again then it is working again! This can be repeated any number of times, from the log file:
{noformat}
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:35:55,508] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:35:55,975] [1] [SourceTree.Dvcss.AbstractDvcs] [InstallationIsEnabled] - Unable to enable installation at System/GitSystemPath configuration is null
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:37:39,600] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:39:42,860] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:39:43,325] [1] [SourceTree.Dvcss.AbstractDvcs] [InstallationIsEnabled] - Unable to enable installation at System/GitSystemPath configuration is null
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:40:38,166] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:41:31,740] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 16:41:32,209] [1] [SourceTree.Dvcss.AbstractDvcs] [InstallationIsEnabled] - Unable to enable installation at System/GitSystemPath configuration is null
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:00:59,411] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:07,940] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:08,403] [1] [SourceTree.Dvcss.AbstractDvcs] [InstallationIsEnabled] - Unable to enable installation at System/GitSystemPath configuration is null
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:17,593] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:25,514] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:25,990] [1] [SourceTree.Dvcss.AbstractDvcs] [InstallationIsEnabled] - Unable to enable installation at System/GitSystemPath configuration is null
ERROR [2017-08-19 17:01:32,615] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
{noformat}
fields.summary: GitSystemPath is null every second start

fields.description: I have two issues.  First, on a screen with resolution of 1920 x 1080, +ANY+ message box that come up is so high that I can not click any button.  I can just barely see the bottom of the box.  Second, on the same resolution as mentioned before the cursor is not visible when I type.  if I move the application window to a monitor with a resolution of 2736 x 1824 all issues go away.  Yes, I understand that I can just use that monitor, but I hate that monitor because it is my Surface tablet.  I'd rather use a real monitor.  Please let me know if any further information is needed.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Message box unreadable and cursor not visible

fields.description:
I have ST shortcut pinned to my taskbar. The shortcut points to {{%localappdata%\SourceTreeBeta\SourceTree.exe}}, as this is the path that doesn't change between updates. This seems to be some kind of Squirrel wrapper?

When I start ST from this shortcut, a second icon appears in the taskbar. This second icon is for {{%localappdata%\SourceTreeBeta\app-2.2.1-beta-0\SourceTree.exe}}, so the actual executable.

!image-2017-08-18-09-53-22-958.png!

Note that this seems to be a mis-configuration of Squirrel, see e.g. https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/issues/1094 for a solution.
fields.summary: Two Taskbar icons when starting from pinned shortcut

fields.description:
I tried to update an old 1.x version by deinstallaing and installing the current 2.x version. Whenever i reach the item "License aggreement" in the installation program and click "use an existing account" i get the message "oops..." after entering "ehoesch@web.de" as login name and password. I tried several older versions without any improvement. I dropped all cookie from all browsers. no effect.
If I click on "Go to my Atlassian" I can login without any problems but i can not see how this can lead to any progress in the installation process. Was a perfect tool on mac and the old 1.x was superb on windows. Now i can not use sourcetree any more.
fields.summary: Always get "Oops, you've made a malformed request" in installation

fields.description:
Trying to fetch or pull from or commit to my Bitbucket repo I always get an error message like this:
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin
remote: Too many invalid password attempts. Try logging in through the website with your password.
fatal: unable to access 'https://janpio@bitbucket.org/janpio/.../': The requested URL returned error: 403

Completed with errors, see above.
{code}
Of course I logged into the account in my browser multiple times - no problem.

`git` on the command line can pull or fetch from, or commit to the repository with no problems.

Maybe some Authentication problem? Well, I can't look at the Authentication data because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-7779

What should I do?
fields.summary: Can't access Bitbucket repo with Sourcetree

fields.description:
Each time I click Tools -> Options -> Authentication I see it loading the content (which seems outdated to be honest) and then the whole app crashes.

I suspect somehow the data it is loading is corrupted. Where does it get the data from?

What do you need to debug that crash? I submitted it a few times, will reproduce again and include this issues ID. (Done.)
fields.summary: Crash on Tools -> Options -> Authentication

fields.description:
Subtree links are randomly lost when closing and re-opening sourcetree.

This began in version 2.1.10.
fields.summary: Subtree links randomly lost.
Tab order does not stick
Appalling slowness

fields.description:
I am using source tree in the past one year and its working fine. I got the new laptop Lenovo Yoga 510 in last month and i installed the Source Tree and its very dead slow.

My colleagues also get the same issue with the Lenovo Yoga 510 laptop.

Can you please check what could be the reason?
fields.summary: Source Tree is very dead slow in Lenovo Yoga 510

fields.description: Extended integration information for remotes is not saved and has to be reconfigured each time Sourcetree is started.
fields.summary: Extended integration information not saved

fields.description: Is anyone fixing the auto-collapsing of folders in the left side pane? BRANCHES and REMOTES keep collapsing. You can respond to bob.alexander@sonosite.com
fields.summary: Folders in side bar keep collapsing.

fields.description:
Sourcetree 2.1 is great.   However, upgrading to 2.1.10.0 made it extremely difficult to use due to non-responsive interface on nearly every action on a very fast computer.

After seeing others with these problems on certain versions, I downgraded to 2.1.7 and found that the performance problem doesn't occur anymore.

The performance problem doesn't seem related to the Internet or virus scanning, I don't have security software enabled, and the Internet is working fast.

It was taking 10 to 20 seconds to do basic actions like refresh or add a repository.   Any remote Bitbucket operations were also very slow, with the green bar on top left seeming to go on forever.  It felt like a single-threaded blocking operation was taking over the interface too often in the new version.
fields.summary: Interface non-responsive, long delays even for local actions

fields.description:
I upgraded from Source Tree 2.0.20.1 to 2.1.10.0 and my login did not work asking for a captcha.

I went to the bit bucket website as advised, logged out and logged in providing the captcha, all worked well there, even logging out and logging in worked.

Went back to source tree and it would still not log in.

Reset password, did not get a message that it passed or failed, but on fetch it did not work.

Closed source tree and tried again, after enough failures got asked for captcha again.

Reset captcha

Restarted source tree, was able to view checked out files, switch between branched, but could not get fetch or pull.

Used link reported in browser that said login failed, and copy/paste into browser (Chrome) it worked fine.

Re-installed 2.0.20.1 and system worked as expected.

Please investigate.
fields.summary: Source Tree 2.1.10.0 Appears to have login issues

fields.description:
After updating to 2.1.10 the following error appears when creating a pull request:
{quote}You don't have any remotes which have extended integration settings configured...
{quote}
This is caused by not having the optional extended integration settings set. Looks like the update clears/deletes these settings for every repository. This is a major annoyance for our users (>1100), since the update is mandatory because of the [security advisory|[https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2017-08-11-933099891.html].]

!image-2017-08-16-13-59-26-979.png!
fields.summary: optional extended integration settings deleted after update

fields.description:
SourceTree is frozen for 4 to 8 seconds on Ctrl+C.

I'm copying from right window (blue line).

Line length doesn't play any role, but anyway it's 70 chars or less.

Note: Photoshop filters on picture to hide text.

!image-2017-08-16-11-12-40-659.png!
fields.summary: Copy "Staged line" to clipboard is slow
I can't clone because of the password error

fields.description:
After upgrade of SourceTree "Check out in SourceTree" does not work in Bitbucket.

I guess the URI association is lost because if I uncheck it and save and then check it again it starts to work.
fields.summary: 'Use this version of Sourcetree for URI association' does not work after update
Pull and push doesn't work when clicking on buttons (see description and screenshots)

fields.description:
* changed my password on corporate github
 * in sourcetree, went to tools / options / authentication, updated the password
 * now I can't push to the remote repo: "authentication failed"
 * restarting sourcetree doesn't help
 * google finds this question in your community: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/Changing-password-in-Source-Tree-1-6-1-Mac-13/qaq-p/283639]
 * see answer by Ray Crawford from 2015, which resolves the issue...

 

In short, the passwd file in ~\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\ is not updated, it still contains the old password. Remove the file, try to push in SourceTree, you are prompted for authentication, a new passwd file is created, now you can push.
fields.summary: Can't update password

fields.description:
What's up with these animations? Please check the attached gif.

It seems like SourceTree team does not understand how to code for HDPI screens or your QA process is extremely lacking.
fields.summary: Dizzy animations

fields.description:
SourceTree is not retrieving Bitbucket password. If I try to fetch, its throwing authentication error as there is no password available. Even on terminal, each command is asking password.

 

I went back to 2.1.2.5 and its working
fields.summary: Unable to retrieve and use stored password

fields.description:
Is is not obvious for a newbie how to continue after resolving conflicts during a rebase.

The confusing thing is that the GUI lets you make a commit while your resolving conflicts (perhaps this is a valid workflow, but for newbies its too confusing), which creates a HEAD, and its very ambiguous what you should do to continue the rebase after all conflicts have been resolved. See this SO thread for more context: [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25887799/using-source-tree-rebase-with-conflict-rebase-doesnt-work-after-conflict-res]

Perhaps the GUI should encourage the user better to continue/abort the rebase as the next steps in the workflow. For example, it could do this by replacing the normal commit button with a "Continue Rebase" button, and add another button for "Abort Rebase". Also hide the "Push changes immediately to - " check box.
fields.summary: Poor UX workflow for "Continue Rebase"

fields.description:
I have a direct requirement to use pull requests to achieve peer-review compliance.  Our team is using git flow but we are unable to use the built-in git flow feature as it does not use the pull-request model.

Ideally, each "Finish ..." action should be configurable to either perform a merge (as it is done currently) or create a pull request.
fields.summary: Support pull-request-based git-flow
ytyt

fields.description:
I have a custom version of git running, and it's registered in the PATH.  Up until recently, having "Use System Git" worked well and found it, and used it.

A recent patch, though, seems to have broken this feature.  At least, it requires me to switch to "use embedded git" and then switch back to "use system git", and then it works.  Next time I start up again, though, it goes back to not using the custom git defined in PATH, until I reswap to "use system git".

It's almost as if it uses embedded git after starting up, until the user pokes it back to using system git.
fields.summary: "Use System Git" requires manual click after every startup

fields.description:
SourceTree version from last year (don't remember version) saved remote credentials for internal corporate GitLab account that uses LDAP authentication. These credentials are no longer valid.

Attempt to create new clone of remote repository uses expired credentials and fails, which is expected. What is unexpected is that multiple authorization attempts are made using the same invalid credentials, causing me to be locked out of my account (the LDAP authentication is shared between the remote server and my local computer).

An attempt to edit the saved credentials did not yield an error message, so I assumed it was successful. Re-attempting to clone the remote repository again failed due to invalid credentials and I was locked out of my account.

One authentication failure should either end the request, prompt to try again, or prompt to try new/updated credentials. One request should never generate enough authorization failures to lock out an account without user intervention telling you to try again.
fields.summary: Multiple failed login attempts per request

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

# find a GIT repository with at least 10 parallel branches (on screenshot artifically created one),
# add this repository to SourceTree,
# display Log/History of this repository,
# double-click between columns "Graph" and "Description".

Expected state: column "Graph" is resized to match whole graph, next column is moved
Current state: column "Graph" is resized but column "Description" is not moved so they overlap.
fields.summary: Graph column - wrong resize after doubleclick between columns

fields.description:
[Bitbucket Server does a good job with release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-5-2-release-notes-917966093.html]. (y)

[SourceTree... well... not so good|https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/windows/ga/ReleaseNotes_2.1.10.0.html]. (n)

Things that could be improved:
* The issue keys that are used don't refer to anything in the public issue tracker. For example, in 2.1.10.0 the issue SRCTREE-2039 was fixed. Clearly that's not the same issue as the one in the public issue tracker, because that one belongs to SourceTree for Mac and hasn't been updated in a year. I understand that you also use an internal issue tracker, but why publish those _internal_ issue keys in the _public_ release notes?
* There's no release dates. I'd like to know when a version was released.
* The release notes tell me things that I won't ever care about. Case in point: 
{quote}SRCTREE-958 Added AutomationProperties AutomationIds to the Main Menu{quote}Awesome, I've been waiting for that new feature! :P Maybe that feature _is_ something I'd find useful, but I have no idea what it could be when you describe it like that.
fields.summary: Release notes could use some love

fields.description:
Hi, 

since it it sadly has mandatory to register online with an Account to use SourceTree, it is not possible to install it in an offline environment(like a virtual machine, that can not have a internet connection).

Is it (legal) possible to copy an existing installation onto the offline computer and use it there?

 

Greets
fields.summary: Using SourceTree in an offline environment

fields.description:
Updated to 2.1.10.0 yesterday, merged a lot of changes from stable to my feature branch today, had a couple of conflicts.

Tried to resolve the conflicts with my external merge tool (P4Merge). Edited the conflicts in P4Merge, saved the changes, closed P4Merge. -> Some of the conflicted files were removed from the conflict list, but most were not. I had to manually git add them.

Some of the files had a double extension, like *.vcxproj.filter, but others were just ordinary *.cpp or *.h files.

In addition, I had a couple of files which I deleted on my branch, but which were changed on the remote branch. Wasn't able to resolve the conflict by clicking "use mine", had to manually git rm them.
fields.summary: Resolving conflicts doesn't work

fields.description:
Ever since the infamous "improvement" in 2.0 SourceTree has been unusable for me on my screens.

Take a look at this:

!image-2017-08-15-10-29-16-318.png!

Menu cut off, dialog unreadable. I still can't minimize by dragging the title bar. Things open outside of my viewport.
fields.summary: SourceTree Win is still an absolute wreck on higher DPI screens

fields.description:
I have a main repository, x, which accesses a submodule, y.  The y submodule references another submodule z.

In x, when I switch branches, z is not switched to its appropriate branch.

I think the --recursive flag maybe is not being used when switching branches.
fields.summary: Switching branches does not recursively update submodules
Crash

fields.description:
This is a usability bug stemming from the fact that we don't have a proper bookmarks/organizational view in Windows SourceTree any more. Some minor usability issues (extra clicks / user-input) are also noted in the repro steps.

I'm setting up a group to represent a workspace with existing repositories on disk.
 # Click on the + tab to get into the view of your repositories and folders
 # Create a folder named something like "My Group"
 # Select My Group, which has nothing in it.
 # Click Add to add the first of several local git repositories to the group
 # (Usability note) You then have to click Browse to select the repository from its location on disk (doesn't Add imply this?)
 # (Usability note) You then also have to select My Group from the Local Folder, or the repository won't be added to it (shouldn't this be implied by the selection of the folder in step 3 before clicking Add?)
 # (Usability note) If you don't change the name of the repository "bookmark" it will be indistinguishable from other copies of that repository in other workspaces in All Repos (shouldn't All Repos display more context like parent folder or full path? Old bookmarks did I believe)

RESULT: the repository you've just added takes over the tab, as if you're going to be working in that view now.

EXPECTED: I'm not trying to work in the repository right now, I'm trying to set up a folder as a workspace. I should be able to add several repositories to the folder without having to continue to select + and get back to it and see a new tab pop open for every one (which I'm just going to close because that's not the work I'm trying to do right now). You need an actual organizational view (ideally requiring fewer clicks) not just a "new-tab mode".
fields.summary: Adding repository to group forces you into repository view

fields.description:
1)Set Windows->settings->accesibility->high contrast
2)Start source tree

3)Notice it wont interact very well with high contrast

4) try to open any menu, most text wont be able to read
fields.summary: Unable to use SourceTree on Windows + Accesibility(high contrast)

fields.description:
Hello,

my Bitbucket username is an email address, when I try to authenticate using sourcetree, I receive this message that my user is not found.

When I authenticate directly to the Bitbucket web GUI, I can access without issues

Do you know a workaround?

The previous source tree version, if I am not mistaken, converted the @ to %40, still it does not work even this way

Regards

 Brian
fields.summary: Auth to Bitbucket Server does not work

fields.description: The latest version features a constant cpu load of around 15% when it should be 0%
fields.summary: 15% constant CPU load on 2.1.10

fields.description:
I like Source Tree (for the most part) but I hate upgrading to a new version of SourceTree because I have to reenter all my credentials and settings all over again. THIS ISN'T UPGRADING its Reinstalling. Why should an existing client be treated like a new client?

Other software (including our own) don't require their users to "re-register", yours shouldn't either!! You have ALL my information from my previous version. So UPGRADE my stuff not reinstall my stuff.

 

Sorry for the rant, but I've had enough of this, I've been using SourceTree since 1.x and I've finally had enough.
fields.summary: Upgrading Sucks!

fields.description:
After the upgrade to 2.1.10.0, beside that SourceTree is slower, the issue we are facing is that in all Editor windows, such as Commit comment, when you click on the Editor window to Type in the commit text, there is No Cursor displayed, and therefore you do not know where is the cursor in the middle of the text if you go back or forth to correct editing mistakes.

This is happening in all Editor windows where you are allowed to type in text, including the Tools->Options Tabs, no Cursor is displayed in any editor field that you click on, and you have to figure out the location of the cursor by typing something then erasing it back
fields.summary: After 2.1.10.0 install, all Editor windows will not display Cursor marker

fields.description:
After an update to Srctree 2.1.10 I cannot push or pull from my Bitbucket repositories. Instead I get a:
{quote}remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
{quote}
I have the correct password set, however, when I open the account in authentication tab, there is a warning that authentication failed :

!login failed.png!

When I click on Refresh password and retype it, the warning turns back to green Authentication OK.

 

I can successfully push and pull via command line, so there must be a bug in the app.
fields.summary: Can't pull or push to bitbucket repo

fields.description:
Everytime I open the list of 'Remotes' and go to origin to view the remote git branches, wierd stuff happens.
That wierd stuff consists of the treeview UI control (that shows the branches) randomly collapsing.
I HATE that.
Sheesh
It can collapse when I open a tree node and simply scroll down.
It can collapse when I select a remote branchCancel
It can eat green eggs and ham
Just fix the dang thing.
fields.summary: Remote List constantly collapses

fields.description:
Windows installed software dialog version is not updated when SourceTree is updated

The version listed under Windows Programs is still 2.1.7.0 and not 2.1.10.0 after updating SourceTree.
fields.summary: Windows installed software dialog version is not updated when SourceTree is updated

fields.description:
I just upgraded to SourceTree 2.1.10.0 and now when i try to pull from remote repo i get this error :

 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch wishgroupe
remote: Empty password
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://yquintaine@bitbucket.org/wishgroupe/boondmanager_labs_documentation.git/'
Completed with errors, see above.

 

It worked perfectly before this update.
fields.summary: Error "remote: empty password"

fields.description:
Before I updated to 2.1.10, I was able to push commits to my Bitbucket repo using both Oauth and Basic authentication. Using both methods, I get the same error. I have confirmed multiple times that I am using the correct password, and I have also refreshed the Oauth key.

 

Here is a picture of the error http://i.imgur.com/toeGS4q.png

 

After update 2.1.10, I am not able to push commits.

Oauth says it is valid and gives me a nice green checkmark, but I cannot commit.

For basic authentication method, I get a parsing error [http://i.imgur.com/mUu1qs2.png]

 

I would have uploaded the pictures as attachments, but I was getting "no token" errors
fields.summary: Basic or Oauth authentication does not work after 2.1.10.0 update

fields.description:
With working copy files I ran "Stash".  This hit a problem which suggested "duplicate cygwin.dll" - I followed the suggestions (check for versions via Windows Explorer - only 1) and reboot (if one version found).

Once I had rebooted I found my Working Copy files removed - and a Stash file in SourceTree, which appeared correct//full, so possibly successful, but unclear. 

The issue is that the message indicated failure but didn't rollback what it had done to that point or indicate partial success.
fields.summary: Running Stash reported problem (duplicate cygwin) but "appeared" to complete ok

fields.description:
Tried to update the version 2.1.7.0 to latest 2.1.10.0 (GA) release using the yellow flag in the top right corner. After that did not succeed and the flag disappeared I re-tried the process through Options - Updates.

I got the dialog stating that another update process was already running.

Then when I tried to restart SourceTree to check if the update succeeded Windows reported a not working SourceTree instance.

{code:java}
Problemsignatur:
  Problemereignisname:	CLR20r3
  Problemsignatur 01:	SourceTree.exe
  Problemsignatur 02:	2.1.7.0
  Problemsignatur 03:	596f557f
  Problemsignatur 04:	Squirrel
  Problemsignatur 05:	1.7.6.0
  Problemsignatur 06:	59485e4e
  Problemsignatur 07:	163
  Problemsignatur 08:	14
  Problemsignatur 09:	System.Threading.AbandonedMutex
  Betriebsystemversion:	6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.48
  Gebietsschema-ID:	1031
  Zusatzinformation 1:	3b86
  Zusatzinformation 2:	3b8671fdf5459fbcb581aa0e7fab23ed
  Zusatzinformation 3:	900e
  Zusatzinformation 4:	900e7b08ab377291bca16e1490c3a64b
{code}

Not relevant to this issue - in extra issue: SRCTREEWIN-7740
The version listed under Windows Programs is still 2.1.7.0 and not 2.1.10.0
fields.summary: Update from 2.1.7.0 to next twice caused issue when SourceTree is closed (System.Threading.AbandonedMutex)

fields.description:
# Double click the toolbar (title bar) to make full screen
 # Click and hold on the toolbar (title bar) are and start to drag
 # Nothing happens. 

*Expected* *behaviour*
 * Once click and start dragging window should pop out of full screen and be in drag mode
 * The window can then be continued to dragged onto another screen
 * Window does not pop back into full screen after drag complete (Default Windows behaviour)
 * This is the standard Windows multi screen behaviour for applications, like Visual Studio, NotePad++, etc
fields.summary: Drag Window in Full Screen blocked

fields.description:
During the installation of SourceTree I have to log into an Atlassian account. However during the installation process I can't login to my account in the installer. However in a normal browser I can login to my Atlassian account. I have already tried creating a new account however I still can not login in the installer. The message I get is:'We've encountered a problem. Please try again in a few minutes' (See attached image). However I have been havind this error for days.  This permits me from using ScourceTree. Help would be very much appreciated!

 

Kind regards,

 

Adriaan
fields.summary: Atlassian login during SourceTree installation

fields.description: I just updated sourcetree this morning and realized that I never find my changed files in the tab "File Status". When I go to "Log / History" I see the message "Uncommiited changes" but the File Status tab show no files
fields.summary: After Update to 2.1.10.0 - "Filte Status" tab never refreshed although there are changed files
Cannot use System Git install through scoop.sh

fields.description:
Navigation:
 # Navigate to: File Status > Working Copy > Unstaged Files
 # Select [any file, other than file index = 1]
 ## ***Note: I have only seen the following behavior when selecting a file before the file content pane has refreshed

 # After the file content pane has refreshed, hit the up or down arrow keys to navigate between files, and it will assume your file index = 1 and start from the top...

Now what I just described above is not hugely detrimental, but what I just had happen was:

Follow the same steps as 1 and 2, but instead of using the arrow keys to navigate, I had scrolled to the bottom of the unstaged files to select a bunch of bogus files that needed to be removed.  So, I depressed the "shift key" to select all items between the last file I selected (which *+was not+* file index = 1), and the last file in unstaged files.  When I selected the last file, and hit remove, *+all files+* in unstaged files were then moved to 'Staged Files' and were staged for being removed. This bug can cause tremendous loss of work. 

 

So, in both cases explained above SourceTree did not maintain the file index which I had selected, and for what it's worth... My note is more of my best educated guess as to what is causing the file indexing to be dropped / overwritten, than any form of concrete knowledge.  Anything you can do to fix this would be greatly appreciated. 

 

FYI - I typically do not like pointing out bugs without having an idea of a solution, but as I do not know how many lines of code I just lost, I thought this was worth mentioning...
fields.summary: Select files to stage - Unstaged file indexing not consistent
Source tree crashes on clicking the commit button
Lannax.检查

fields.description: After auto-upgrade of SourceTree to 2.1.8, the UI tool lost the ability to authenticate using SSH keys when I need to Push. However, if I go to the Terminal window, it asks me for password, and completes the PUSH command.
fields.summary: Lost ablity to authenticate
Failed to extract file error with gcmw.zip occurred when trying to clone repo from browser integration link

fields.description:
While also other Git Clients have successfully changed the Atlassian product names SourceTree in version 2.1.7.0 is still referencing Atlassian Stash. Configuring a remote host type might be tricky because with a local Bitbucket server it is not as straight-forward since Bitbucket(.org) is the wrong choice ... you need to select Stash.

!SourceTree_2.1.7.0_Remote_Details_Stash.JPG|thumbnail!

Expected Host Types:
Unknown
Bitbucket.org
GitHub
Bitbucket Server

Actual Host Types:
Unknown
Bitbucket
GitHub
{color:red}Stash{color}

Since at least one year now Stash is now Bitbucket Server.

Atlassian Stash [https://de.atlassian.com/software/stash] was transformed into Bitbucket Server https://de.atlassian.com/software/bitbucket/server
fields.summary: Remote Repository Setting Host Type is still Stash instead of Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
The view is not displayed properly as per screenshot attached. The problem was mentioned in SRCTREEWIN-1573 but was not resolved back then, falselly assumed as duplicate of SRCTREEWIN-1519

The DPI settings in Windows are all at standard defaults - 100%.
fields.summary: Branch view is not displaying results properly in Windows Server 2012

fields.description:
The arrow button on Choose a Lot drop down menu , appear to have GUI error, as it is divided on two with different type of graphic.

Step to Reproduce:
 * Load the Online calculator page in Internet Explorer
 * Look at the arrow button

Expected Result: The arrow button appear in correct form( blue field of button, with white arrow pointing bottom) please see snapshot1 attached.

 

Actual Result: The arrow button appear to be incorrect divided on 2 with different interface, please see snapshot2 attached.
fields.summary: GUI bug appears on the button of the drop down menu of Choose a Lot field, when we use Internet Explorer to test the Online Calculator
When Entry date and Leaving date are left unselected and calculate button is pressed, text and color of the error message which appear is not correct

fields.description:
Step to Reproduce:
 * Enter Long Term Surface Parking in Parking Lot Field
 * Enter 08/09 as entry date
 * Enter 12:15AM for entry hour
 * Enter 08/17 as leaving date
 * Enter 12:00AM as leaving time
 * Press Calculate Button

 


Expected Result: there should be an error displayed “You are not allowed to park for such long period here” colored in red


Actual Result: Calculator continues to calculate cost and time period.
fields.summary: When Long Term Surface Parking is choosen, error message doesn't appear when we choose time period longer than 7 days.

fields.description:
Step to Reproduce:
 * Enter Long Term Garage Parking in Parking Lot Field
 * Enter 08/09 as entry date
 * Enter 12:15AM for entry hour
 * Enter 08/17 as leaving date
 * Enter 12:00AM as leaving time
 * Press Calculate Button

 


Expected Result: there should be an error displayed “You are not allowed to park for such long period here” colored in red


Actual Result: Calculator continues to calculate cost and time period.
fields.summary: When Long Term Garage Parking is choosen, error message doesn't appear when we choose time period longer than 7 days.

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
 * Choose Short Term Parking Lot
 * Enter 08/09 as entry date
 * Enter 01:15AM for entry hour
 * Enter 08/09 as leaving date
 * Enter 02:45AM as leaving time
 * Press the calculate button

 

Expected Result: In the cost field price of 3$ appears

 

Actual Result: In the cost field price of 4$ appears.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Select Short Tem lot in the lot field
 * Enter 08/09/2012 for entry date
 * Enter 12:15AM  entry time
 * Enter 08/10/2012 for leaving day
 * Enter 12:30 AM for leave time

 

Expected Result: Error message in red color appears"You cannot select more than one day for this parking type”

Actual Result:No error message appears, calculator calculates price of 26$

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:
 * Chose Short Term parking from Chose a lot drop down menu
 * Enter 09/08 as entry date
 * Enter 12:15AM for entry hour
 * Enter 09/08 as leaving date
 * Enter 01:00PM as leaving time
 * Press the calculate button

Expected Result: In the Cost field price of 24$ appears, as this is the price for period longer than 12h in Short term Parking.

Actual Result: Price of 26$ appears in the Cost fiel
fields.summary: On Short Term Parking lot, incorrect price of 24$ appears when you calculate time period of 12:h45min

fields.description:
My steps to reproduce
 # Launch SourceTree
 # Open a large git repo with lots of branching and long history
 # Switch the active application to something other than SourceTree
 # Wait for SourceTree.exe to go idle (<1% cpu usage in Task Manager)
 # Switch back to the application

Exepected behavior
 * Application would go idle very quickly, and there would be little change in over all application memory usage

Actual behavior
 * Cpu usage of application of the application takes up one of my cpu threads (13-15% on an 4 core / 8 thread CPU) for almost 30-40 seconds, while memory usage will increase and decrease by as much as 400-500 MB before the process completes.

 

As noted, this seems to be highly dependant on the repository which is open.  When i close my main (large) project and switch to something with very little branching or a smaller commit history, this problem appears to largely disappear.

During this period, Windows will frequently mark the application window as unresponsive periodically for a second or two (the standard windows title bar, and red x render over the blue window bar).  The application itself responds to mouse clicks very erratically or slowly.
fields.summary: Large CPU and memory fluctuations after simple Alt-Tab switching to SourceTree

fields.description:
This appears to be a regression (at least I've never noticed it before) and is reproducible:

When a commit with at least two changed files is first opened (it disappears after clicking long enough but reappears when selecting another commit and then the current commit again) and the first changed file is clicked, the diff of that file is shown correctly. When selecting the second changed file, the diff from the first file *remains* and the diff of the second file is appended below.

Sometimes the bug already appears when first displaying a commit and clicking the first file; then sometimes the diff view doesn't change at all and still shows _all_ changes.

Expected would of course be, that only the diff of the second file appear.
fields.summary: Diff View for specific File shows chunk of other file

fields.description:
A branch was deleted on the remote, and when I open my local repository, which has been fetched via command line, a dialog keeps popping up with "git log failed with code 128: fatal: bad revision 'origin/<branchname>'".

Only problem is that I cannot change anything since the popup keeps coming faster than I can click anything.

I was able to close other tabs in SourceTree for other repositories, but the one failing I cannot close. It seems hung on failing with the mentioned error.

Every time I restart SourceTree the problem starts over.

(It does however create a pretty pattern, see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Endless "git log failed" dialogs popup

fields.description:
* Have a project with a submodule
 * alter the submodule code
 * look at the project
 * see a line added about uncommited changes
 * click the line, see nothing as far as changes
 * go to the submodule, and commit that
 * go back to project, and now the altered submodule hash shows as a change to commit

I would suggest that you need to indicate actually a submodule change, and which submodule since there's no other way to discover it, coming back from interruption, etc..

This exacerbates problems you have never fixed post 1.9 with changed files listing often enough being incomplete – so that you commit, and then find you have more altered files that should have been see so committed. Makes everything about SourceTree feel like shakey ground, this kind of thing.

 

As well, the slow startup with at least two visible for instant flash-up windows does not instill confidence. I keep 1.9 handy, and wonder why you don't make this version set work as well.
fields.summary: submodule changes indicated in parent, but nothing shows

fields.description:
1.10.24 is not in the affected version dropdown.

Registry value is set as %user%\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-2.0.20.1\SourceTree.exe" -url "%1"
Location : HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\sourcetree\shell\open\command

'Use this version of Sourcetree for URI association' option is checked. 

A dialog box appears quickly on my desktop but goes away too quickly, so the exact error is not available.
fields.summary: Checkout in SourceTree button no longer works properly with url associations.

fields.description:
I recently had to change my system password and for some odd reason, I'm not able to push from Sourcetree UI and everytime, it gives me authentication failure.

I've gone into Tools->Options->Authentication and I see the following screenshot:

!image-2017-08-07-12-33-12-309.png!

I'm not able to delete the saved password that has "brajan@" at all! 

Uninstalling and re-installing is useless. How can I delete this and enter fresh credentials?
fields.summary: Sourcetree UI cannot push - authentication failure

fields.description:
Came back from a week away and SourceTree didn't start (not sure which version) so uninstalled it, downloaded 2.1.2.5, ran the installer and saw the following:
 # the splash screen appears briefly (sometimes - I've tried this a few times); and then
 # the general non-descriptive error as shown in the screenshot attached.

If I click the "Debug the program button", I get an "An unhandled Microsoft .NET Framework exception occurred in SourceTree.exe [8140]. Just-In-Time debugging this exception failed with the following error: No installed debugger has Just-In-Time debugging enabled." - which seems like it's due to me not having Visual Studio setup / not being a .NET developer (rather than anything to do with the issue described).

Just to be sure, I went and installed the latest .NET (4.7) - no effect. Updated Git - no effect.

 

*Update:*

I downgraded to archive version 2.0.20.1 which works. It then asks if I would like to upgrade to 2.1.10 if I do, then it stops working again with the issue described above.
fields.summary: Cannot install (or start) on Windows 10

fields.description:
After updating Git from 2.13.3 to 2.14.0

Attempted to fetch from origin.

 

Error message received:
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=manager-st fetch --prune origin
Stash cannot not execute "git upload-pack '/iswa/ismms-core.git'". The command is not supported as entered.
Ensure you are using a supported SCM, check the syntax and try again.

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

Completed with errors, see above.{noformat}
fields.summary: SourceTree does not work with Git 2.14.0

fields.description:
If I expand an un-maximised SourceTree to cover multiple monitors and then subsequently maximise it, an 8px wide slice is left on all the other monitors and never goes away.

The height of the slice is equal to the height of the un-maximised window.
fields.summary: Maximising on multi-monitor setup creates overhang

fields.description: I updated to 2.1.8.0 and since then clicking on the "Use System Git" button does nothing anymore. Worked fine in 2.1.2.5.
fields.summary: Cannot switch to system git anymore

fields.description:
When I opened the SourceTree software there were a message saying there were a new version, I confirmed to install it.

Then I entered the menu "Options->Check for updates"

There were nothing indicating there were a process already on going, not a loader, nothing. Since my internet connection was slow, I clicked to check for updates again and it promped a message, as you can see in [this image|https://image.prntscr.com/image/0fi7-myQQgu5eTyNCBpjrQ.png].

The button "Cancel" seems to be confusing in this context. Will it cancel the ongoing progress? Will it just close the prompt dialog?

Maybe changing it to "Ok" or "Close" will make more sense, unless the button actually cancel the progress, but then, maybe add a message "Would you like to cancel the on going progress?"

I'm sure the FrontEnd guys will know hwo to handle this.
fields.summary: Button label during check for update is confusing

fields.description:
The SourceTree website does not offer the latest version of SourceTree, and offers inconsistent downloads on different pages:

For reference, the latest version of SourceTree is *2.1.8.0*

At [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] , clicking "Download free" downloads 2.1.2.5

At [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/download-archives] , clicking "Download free" downloads 2.6.1.a (which is probably a Mac build, but is not listed under "Mac")

The latest Windows version _listed_ on that page is 2.1.2.5

Due to these inconsistencies it is impossible to download the latest version from the website, or even find out what the latest version _is._
fields.summary: SourceTree website missing versions

fields.description: see https://community.atlassian.com/t5/SourceTree-questions/Autmatically-set-Option-quot-Allow-SourceTree-to-modify-your/qaq-p/619350
fields.summary: "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial conﬁg ﬁles" option cannot be unset.

fields.description:
When I 'restore down' SourceTree, it is taller than the accessible desktop area. The window extends pass the start menu. There is no way to shorten the window, because I can't resize it from the top border. The bottom border is blocked by the start menu.

Please make it resizable from the top border like every application in windows.
fields.summary: Window should be resizable from the top

fields.description:
I work on multiple products and usually each product has multiple repos.  I've organized the repo sets into the ST folders to make my repo hunting a little easier.

A very useful feature with repo folders is using them to switch between open repo tab sets - select one of the folders (right-click + Open as Tabs??) and ST would close existing repo tabs and open all repos in the folder (and in the order listed in the folder) when selecting it.
fields.summary: Make repo folders switchable open repo tab groups
Version 2.1.8: Unstaged changes are always shown but no files were changed

fields.description:
In the bitbucket.org and in heinemann-hmh project and hmn-odms repository, I have attempted to merge from one branch to another branch without selecting the 'Close the source branch' option and that has deleted 25 branches.

The below image shows 55 branches, but when it is clicked there are only 30 branches. 25 branches are deleted without any trail.

Some of the names of the branches missing are 

BugFixes-Development

BugFixes-Staging

BugFixes-Staging-LLI_2ndEdition

Please fix this issue and bring back the missing branches immediately. All our important code checkins are missing.
fields.summary: Merging a branch removed several branches in bitbucket.org

fields.description: It would be really nice if I could filter my git history by authors, date ranges or strings. Is there any chance that you implement such a feature?
fields.summary: Git commit filter
Cannot see Release Notes

fields.description:
The bug is located in Online Parking Calculator on [http://www.grr.org/parking-calculator.php]. This is the webpage of Gerald R. Ford International Airport. The bug appears in Short-term parking lot when you type that exit time and date is before entry time and date. The test was made on Windows 7 OS with Google Chrome browser.

Steps to reproducing the bug:
 # Go to [http://www.grr.org/parking-calculator.php]
 # Choose Short-term parking lot field
 # Type 08/15/2017 in entry date field in MM/DD/YYYY format
 # Type 09:00 AM in entry time field
 # Type 08/15/2017 in exit date field in MM/DD/YYYY format
 # Type 08:00 AM in exit time field
 # Press Calculate button

Actual result: It appears message with -1D/23H/0M and cost of 0$. 

Expected result: Error message: your exit time is before entry time

Severity is Minor, because the software can work with this bug, without representing any difficulty. 

Priority is Medium, because in business point of view you can give the software in this condition to the client and it will work, but it can bring confusion in the customers when use it, so it has to be fixed as soon as possible.
fields.summary: No error message for invalid entry and exit time in OPC

fields.description:
Show the second+ line of commit messages on in the commit history table.

Example design:

!Capture.PNG!
fields.summary: Log/History: Show multiline commit messages in commit history table

fields.description:
The bug is on [https://www.bloomberg.com/europe] webpage on the search field. When you type some invalid input (e.g. #,/,@) a pop-up error message should appear on the screen. Instead of this its appears only blank screen. The test was made on Windows 7 Home Premium OS with Google Chrome browser. 

Steps to reproducing the bug:
 # Go to [https://www.bloomberg.com/europe]
 # Open search field
 # Fill search field with invalid information (e.g.#,/,@)
 # Press Search button

Actual results: blank screen appears with no information about the search results

Expected results: Pop-up error message should appear

The Severity is Minor, because the system can work without fixing this bug and do not represent any difficulty from technical matter

The Priority is Low, because its not important from business view and can be given to the client in this condition and to be fixed in undefined time frame.
fields.summary: No pop-up error message appears

fields.description:
When checking out a branch in SourceTree from Bitbucket, SourceTree crashes.

The URI association works, the problem is how SourceTree is handling the command line parameters.

SourceTree.exe is being passed these parameters (I've replaced the branch, username and repo with placeholders for this example):
{noformat}
SourceTree.exe -url "sourcetree://checkoutRef/?ref=refs/heads/<branch>&cloneUrl=ssh://git@bitbucket.org/<username>/<repo>.git&type=bitbucket"{noformat}
I can reproduce this error on the Windows command line.

Here's the smallest reproducible command that causes the same error.
{noformat}
SourceTree.exe -url "sourcetree://checkoutRef/?ref=&cloneUrl=&type=bitbucket"{noformat}
When run while SourceTree is open nothing is logged. When SourceTree is closed the following error is logged in "sourcetree.log":
{noformat}
ERROR [2017-08-03 15:49:17,773] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.GetCanonicalUri(IConfigurationManager configurationManager)
at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.get_CanonicalUrl()
at SourceTree.AppRoot.HandleExtendedIntegrationUrl(Boolean isFirstInstance, String url)
at SourceTree.AppRoot.ProcessArguments(Boolean isFirstInstance)
at SourceTree.AppRoot.DoWindowStartupTasks()
at SourceTree.ViewModel.MainWindowViewModel..ctor(IRepositoryTabContainerViewModel repositoryTabContainerViewModel, ICustomActionsManager customActionsManager, IRepositoryManager repositoryManager, IAnalyticsDataManager analyticsDataManager, ITraceManager traceManager, IDispatcher dispatcher, IAccountManager accountManager, IFailureHandler failureHandler, IDvcsManager dvcsManager, IConfigurationManager configurationManager, IInstanceManager instanceManager, ISchedulerManager schedulerManager, IWebManager webManager, IRepositoryMonitorManager repositoryMonitorManager, ISshKeyManager sshKeyManager, INotificationsManager notificationsManager, IPreferencesManager preferencesManager)
at SourceTree.MainWindow..ctor(IRepositoryTabContainerViewModel repositoryTabContainerViewModel, ICustomActionsManager customActionsManager, IRepositoryManager repositoryManager, IAnalyticsDataManager analyticsDataManager, ITraceManager traceManager, IDispatcher dispatcher, IAccountManager accountManager, IFailureHandler failureHandler, IDvcsManager dvcsManager, IConfigurationManager configurationManager, IInstanceManager instanceManager, ISchedulerManager schedulerManager, IWebManager webManager, IRepositoryMonitorManager repositoryMonitorManager, IApplicationManager applicationManager, ISshKeyManager sshKeyManager, INotificationsManager notificationsManager, IBookmarkManager bookmarkManager, IPreferencesManager preferencesManager)
at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Bitbucket "Check out your branch" error

fields.description:
The list of Repos show the yellow [...], purple [?], etc and the gray [master ↓4], and it would be nice to show only the repos which may need attention.

Could we get a drop down filter above/near the Search bar that filters the current folder to show 'Repos with Pending Changes' or 'Repos that are behind tracked branch'?

 

Alternately, a summary of the Repos a folder in the folder bar would be nice.
fields.summary: Show a summary of Repo changes in New Tab

fields.description:
I was using the previous version and was asked by SourceTree if I want to upgrade.  I answered "Yes" and restarted SourceTree.  Each time I am trying to start SourceTree, I get the message "SourceTree has stopped working"

Problem signature:
 Problem Event Name: APPCRASH
 Application Name: SourceTree_ExecutionStub.exe
 Application Version: 2.1.7.0
 Application Timestamp: 59485e52
 Fault Module Name: SourceTree_ExecutionStub.exe
 Fault Module Version: 2.1.7.0
 Fault Module Timestamp: 59485e52
 Exception Code: c0000005

 Locale ID: 4105
 Additional Information 1: 0a9e
 Additional Information 2: 0a9e372d3b4ad19135b953a78882e789

Read our privacy statement online:
 http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=104288&clcid=0x0409

If the online privacy statement is not available, please read our privacy statement offline:
 C:\Windows\system32\en-US\erofflps.txt
fields.summary: Crash after upgrading to SourceTree 2.1.7.0

fields.description:
PC: Surface PRO

Display: Secondary

MODE: Full Screen

SourceTree UI gets blocked by hidden popup (Confirm Discard) when run on Secondary Monitor at full screen mode.

Go Around:
 # Alt+Tab and Close Popup 
!problem1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Bring the SourceTree from Full to Normal mode
 # Discard
 !Success.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SourceTree UI gets blocked by hidden popup (Confirm Discard) when run on Secondary Monitor at full screen mode
